snippet: Prosecutors said three doctors and an ex-Social Security Administration employee were among those who had helped people get disability benefits they did not qualify for.
abstract: Federal prosecutors announce that more than 70 people have been indicted in Puerto Rico as part of a two-year investigation into widespread fraud in Social Security disability payments.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors said three doctors and an ex-Social Security Administration employee were among those who had helped people get disability benefits they did not qualify for.

headline.main: 70 Are Indicted in Puerto Rico in Social Security Fraud
headline.print_headline: 70 Indicted in Puerto Rico in Social Security Fraud Linked to an Agency Employee
